tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE hydropower_generation (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  date DATE,
  location VARCHAR(50),
  generation_capacity FLOAT,
  actual_generation FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE hydropower_generation (
  location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  date DATE,
  generation_kwh FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE hydropower_locations (
  location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location_name VARCHAR(255),
  country VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE hydropower_trends (
  trend_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  trend_name VARCHAR(255),
  start_date DATE,
  end_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE generation_data (
  data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  site_id INT,
  generation_date DATE,
  generation_amount DECIMAL(10,2),
  FOREIGN KEY (site_id) REFERENCES hydropower_sites(site_id)
);

CREATE TABLE maintenance_logs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  site_id INT,
  maintenance_date DATE,
  maintenance_details TEXT,
  FOREIGN KEY (site_id) REFERENCES hydropower_sites(site_id)
);

CREATE TABLE weather_data (
  weather_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  site_id INT,
  weather_date DATE,
  temperature DECIMAL(5,2),
  precipitation DECIMAL(5,2),
  FOREIGN KEY (site_id) REFERENCES hydropower_sites(site_id)
);

CREATE TABLE generation_records (
    record_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    plant_id INT NOT NULL,
    generation_date DATE NOT NULL,
    generation_time TIME NOT NULL,
    generation_amount FLOAT NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE maintenance_logs (
    log_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    plant_id INT NOT NULL,
    log_date DATE NOT NULL,
    log_time TIME NOT NULL,
    description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE outage_reports (
    report_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    plant_id INT NOT NULL,
    outage_date DATE NOT NULL,
    outage_time TIME NOT NULL,
    reason TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE weather_conditions (
    condition_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    plant_id INT NOT NULL,
    condition_date DATE NOT NULL,
    temperature FLOAT NOT NULL,
    weather VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);
